snippet: Anne Smedinghoff, 25, joined the Foreign Service three years ago and moved to Kabul in July. She died, her parents said, doing a job she thought must be done.
abstract: Family and friends of Anne Smedinghoff, Foreign Service member who died in suicide bomb attack in Afghanistan, recall way in which she chafed at circumscribed life in war-torn country, and remember her eagerness to ease tumult of Afghans' everyday lives.
lead_paragraph: Anne Smedinghoff, 25, joined the Foreign Service three years ago and moved to Kabul in July. She died, her parents said, doing a job she thought must be done.

headline.seo: U.S. Diplomat Killed on Afghan Mission She Coveted
headline.main: Diplomat Killed on Afghan Mission She Coveted
headline.print_headline: Diplomat Killed on Afghan Mission She Coveted
